title: What Liz Cheney’s Lopsided Loss Says About the State of the G.O.P.
abstract: She hoped Jan. 6 would be a turning point for Republicans. And while it did prove to be a dividing line, it was those who crossed Donald J. Trump who have faced electoral consequences.

multimedia.caption: In her concession speech on Tuesday in Jackson, Wyo., Representative Liz Cheney pledged to “do whatever it takes” to prevent a second Trump presidency.

title: Behind Enemy Lines, Ukrainians Tell Russians ‘You Are Never Safe’
abstract: Clandestine resistance cells are spotting targets, sabotaging rail lines and killing those deemed collaborators as they seek to unnerve Russian forces.

title: German Utility Reports Huge Loss as Russia Slashes Gas Flows
abstract: Uniper, Germany’s largest importer of natural gas, has had to pay high prices for gas on the open market to make up for the drop in Russian deliveries.

title: Giuliani Appears Before Atlanta Grand Jury Investigating Trump
abstract: The former New York mayor has been told that he is a target in the investigation concerning whether Donald J. Trump and his associates tried to illegally influence the 2020 presidential election results in Georgia.

title: ‘I’m Done With Him’: A Mother’s Anger Over Rushdie Attack
abstract: Hadi Matar, 24, kept to himself and was changed by a 2018 trip to the Middle East.
byline: By Chelsia Rose Marcius, Tracey Tully and Ana Facio-Krajcer

title: Tech Hacks to Make Traveling Right Now Less of a Headache
abstract: The travel industry is recovering from the pandemic, but messily. These apps and tips can help us navigate the chaos and maximize our comfort.

title: At Last, Online Travel Planning Is Becoming (a Little) Easier
abstract: Airbnb, Google Travel and a few other platforms have tweaked their search engines, and that means less slogging through pages and pages of results on everything from home rental options to flight routes.

title: Mexico Sees Its Energy Future in Fossil Fuels, Not Renewables
abstract: The president’s push to bring the energy sector under state control has put up roadblocks to renewable energy and left Mexico’s climate goals behind.
